Working With brms

Source: vignettes/brms.Rmd
brms.Rmd
library(shredder)
library(brms)

Generate Data

group <- rep(c("treat", "placebo"), 
             each = 30)

symptom_post <- c(
  rnorm(30, mean = 1, sd = 2), 
  rnorm(30, mean = 0, sd = 1)
)

dat1 <- data.frame(group, symptom_post)

Run Model

fit <- brm(bf(symptom_post ~ group, sigma ~ group), 
           data = dat1, 
           family = gaussian(),
           seed = 1234)
 Family: gaussian 
  Links: mu = identity; sigma = log 
Formula: symptom_post ~ group 
         sigma ~ group
   Data: dat1 (Number of observations: 60) 
Samples: 4 chains, each with iter = 2000; warmup = 1000; thin = 1;
         total post-warmup samples = 4000

Population-Level Effects: 
                 Estimate Est.Error l-95% CI u-95% CI    Rhat Bulk_ESS Tail_ESS
Intercept        -0.27716   0.19433 -0.65481  0.11009 0.99974     5626     2985
sigma_Intercept   0.05568   0.13724 -0.19060  0.34482 1.00108     3208     2949
grouptreat        0.87843   0.42052  0.04338  1.69346 1.00189     3179     2288
sigma_grouptreat  0.62636   0.19312  0.24906  1.00060 1.00105     3565     2943

Samples were drawn using sampling(NUTS). For each parameter, Bulk_ESS
and Tail_ESS are effective sample size measures, and Rhat is the potential
scale reduction factor on split chains (at convergence, Rhat = 1).
fit%>%
  plot(N = 2, ask = FALSE)

Select first 100 Posterior Samples from each Chain

fit_slice <- fit%>%stan_slice(1:100)
 Family: gaussian 
  Links: mu = identity; sigma = log 
Formula: symptom_post ~ group 
         sigma ~ group
   Data: dat1 (Number of observations: 60) 
Samples: 4 chains, each with iter = 1100; warmup = 1000; thin = 1;
         total post-warmup samples = 400

Population-Level Effects: 
                 Estimate Est.Error l-95% CI u-95% CI    Rhat Bulk_ESS Tail_ESS
Intercept        -0.27744   0.20796 -0.67379  0.13599 1.01256      671      231
sigma_Intercept   0.04760   0.13969 -0.20919  0.32705 1.00878      261      283
grouptreat        0.80804   0.45059 -0.11136  1.63230 1.00927      282      222
sigma_grouptreat  0.62551   0.20330  0.24888  0.99686 1.01040      380      282

Samples were drawn using sampling(NUTS). For each parameter, Bulk_ESS
and Tail_ESS are effective sample size measures, and Rhat is the potential
scale reduction factor on split chains (at convergence, Rhat = 1).
fit_slice%>%
  plot(N = 2, ask = FALSE)

Thin 25% of Posterior Samples from each Chain

fit_thin <- fit%>%
  stan_thin_frac(0.25)
 Family: gaussian 
  Links: mu = identity; sigma = log 
Formula: symptom_post ~ group 
         sigma ~ group
   Data: dat1 (Number of observations: 60) 
Samples: 4 chains, each with iter = 1250; warmup = 1000; thin = 1;
         total post-warmup samples = 1000

Population-Level Effects: 
                 Estimate Est.Error l-95% CI u-95% CI    Rhat Bulk_ESS Tail_ESS
Intercept        -0.27240   0.19215 -0.64031  0.13263 1.00046     1033      891
sigma_Intercept   0.05180   0.13697 -0.18929  0.32999 1.00077      962      995
grouptreat        0.85955   0.42513 -0.00019  1.73706 0.99960     1044      934
sigma_grouptreat  0.63331   0.18969  0.25733  0.99464 1.00241      985      955

Samples were drawn using sampling(NUTS). For each parameter, Bulk_ESS
and Tail_ESS are effective sample size measures, and Rhat is the potential
scale reduction factor on split chains (at convergence, Rhat = 1).
fit_thin%>%
  plot(N = 2, ask = FALSE)

Filter Posterior Samples by Conditional

fit_filter <- fit%>%
  stan_filter(b_grouptreat>=1)
 Family: gaussian 
  Links: mu = identity; sigma = log 
Formula: symptom_post ~ group 
         sigma ~ group
   Data: dat1 (Number of observations: 60) 
Samples: 4 chains, each with iter = 1362; warmup = 1000; thin = 1;
         total post-warmup samples = 1448

Population-Level Effects: 
                 Estimate Est.Error l-95% CI u-95% CI    Rhat Bulk_ESS Tail_ESS
Intercept        -0.37921   0.17603 -0.71413 -0.03775 1.00204     1205     1318
sigma_Intercept   0.05663   0.13992 -0.18859  0.35741 1.00237      800     1128
grouptreat        1.29602   0.24417  1.01113  1.94179 1.00069      978      821
sigma_grouptreat  0.62853   0.19392  0.23632  1.00022 1.00441      684      683

Samples were drawn using sampling(NUTS). For each parameter, Bulk_ESS
and Tail_ESS are effective sample size measures, and Rhat is the potential
scale reduction factor on split chains (at convergence, Rhat = 1).
fit_filter%>%
  plot(N = 2, ask = FALSE)

Filter Posterior Samples by Conditional Subset Chain

fit_filter_chain <- fit%>%
  stan_filter(b_grouptreat>=1)%>%
  stan_retain(chains = 1)
 Family: gaussian 
  Links: mu = identity; sigma = log 
Formula: symptom_post ~ group 
         sigma ~ group
   Data: dat1 (Number of observations: 60) 
Samples: 1 chains, each with iter = 1362; warmup = 1000; thin = 1;
         total post-warmup samples = 362

Population-Level Effects: 
                 Estimate Est.Error l-95% CI u-95% CI    Rhat Bulk_ESS Tail_ESS
Intercept        -0.37942   0.16766 -0.69772 -0.05652 1.01472      391      322
sigma_Intercept   0.05700   0.14024 -0.19564  0.34921 0.99882      186      236
grouptreat        1.29769   0.26655  1.00777  2.05558 0.99872      239      164
sigma_grouptreat  0.62816   0.20959  0.22023  1.03853 0.99846      258      222

Samples were drawn using sampling(NUTS). For each parameter, Bulk_ESS
and Tail_ESS are effective sample size measures, and Rhat is the potential
scale reduction factor on split chains (at convergence, Rhat = 1).
fit_filter_chain%>%
  plot(N = 2, ask = FALSE)
